alert.note: Alert for Androscoggin; Central Interior Cumberland; Interior Cumberland Highlands; Interior Waldo; Kennebec; Southern Franklin; Southern Oxford; Southern Somerset (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued February 03 at 2:42AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...A line of heavy snow showers will affect Kennebec...northwestern Waldo...southern Oxford...Androscoggin...southeastern Somerset... northwestern Cumberland and southeastern Franklin Counties... At 242 AM EST...A line of heavy snow showers was along a line extending from near Guilford to near Hiram...and moving east AT 35 MPH. Locations impacted include... Lewiston, Augusta, Waterville, Conway, Farmington, Fairfield, Gardiner, Bridgton, Fryeburg, Mechanic Falls, Skowhegan, Naples, Pittsfield, Thorndike, Oakland, Turner, Topsham, Freeport, Gray and Madison. This includes the following highways... Interstate 295 between mile markers 21 and 22, and between mile markers 47 and 51. Interstate 95 between mile markers 63 and 156. This also includes... Pleasant Mountain, Long Lake, Crocker Hill, Streaked Mountain, and Singepole Ridge. * Winds in excess of 35 mph are possible with this area of heavy snow showers. * Visibilities will drop quickly to less than a half mile in this area of heavy snow showers. Conditions can deteriorate rapidly in winter weather situations. Be prepared for snow or ice covered roads. Slow down and allow extra time when traveling.
